qas.question: In which year did Imperial merge with St Mary's Hospital Medical School?
Which school resulted from Imperial's merger with St Mary's?

answers.text: The Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine

qas.question: Who did Imperial partner with to launch the Imperial College Press?
What year was the Imperial College School of Medicine formally established?
What is the name of the building that was opened by Queen Elizabeth II?

plausible_answers.text: The Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine.

qas.question: What scool split into Imperial and and St Maries?
When did Imperial start its publishng house World Scientific?

plausible_answers.text: Charing Cross and Westminster Medical School, Royal Postgraduate Medical School (RPMS) and the Institute of Obstetrics and Gynaecology

qas.question: What schools came out of Imperial in 1997?
What school was founded by Sit Alexander Fleming?

context: In <a0_0>1988<a0_0/> Imperial merged with St Mary's Hospital Medical School, becoming <a1_0><b5_0>The Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine<a1_0/>.<b5_0/> In <b6_0>1995<b6_0/> Imperial launched its own academic publishing house, Imperial College Press, in partnership with <a2_0>World Scientific<a2_0/>. Imperial merged with the National Heart and Lung Institute in 1995 and the <b7_0>Charing Cross and Westminster Medical School, Royal Postgraduate Medical School (RPMS) and the Institute of Obstetrics and Gynaecology<b7_0/> in <a3_0>1997<a3_0/>. In the same year the Imperial College School of Medicine was formally established and all of the property of Charing Cross and Westminster Medical School, the National Heart and Lung Institute and the <b8_0>Royal Postgraduate Medical School<b8_0/> were transferred to Imperial as the result of the Imperial College Act 1997. In 1998 the <a4_0>Sir Alexander Fleming Building<a4_0/> was opened by Queen Elizabeth II to provide a headquarters for the College's medical and biomedical research.
